prompt:
Kann ich die Benutzerprofilfelder, die aus dem OpenID Connect-Anbieter in XWiki gefüllt werden, anpassen?
Ich möchte zusätzliche Benutzerprofilfelder von meinem OpenID Connect-Anbieter an XWiki-Benutzereigenschaften abbilden. Wie kann ich das erreichen?
expected_answer:
Ja, Sie können die Benutzerprofilfelder, die aus dem OpenID Connect-Anbieter gefüllt werden, anpassen, indem Sie sie in der Datei `xwiki.properties` abbilden.

Um zusätzliche Benutzerprofilfelder abzubilden, verwenden Sie die Eigenschaft `oidc.user.mapping`. Hier ist ein Beispiel, wie Sie benutzerdefinierte Eigenschaften abbilden können:

```
# oidc.user.mapping=myxproperty1=${oidc.user.subject}
# oidc.user.mapping=myxproperty2=myprefix-${oidc.user.subject}
```

Ersetzen Sie `myxproperty1` und `myxproperty2` durch die tatsächlichen XWiki-Benutzereigenschaftennamen und `${oidc.user.subject}` durch die entsprechende Variable basierend auf den Daten, die von Ihrem OpenID Connect-Anbieter bereitgestellt werden.

Nachdem Sie die Zuordnungen konfiguriert haben, speichern Sie die Datei `xwiki.properties` und starten Sie XWiki neu, um die Änderungen anzuwenden.
ai_answer:
https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/OpenID%20Connect/OpenID%20Connect%20Authenticator/ 
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Authentication/ 


 Based on the information provided, I can suggest a general approach to map additional user profile fields from your OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider to XWiki user properties. However, I cannot provide specific steps without knowing the exact OIDC provider and XWiki version you are using.

1. **Understand the OIDC User Info Endpoint**: The OpenID Connect Provider should have a UserInfo endpoint that returns claims (user attributes) in a standard JSON format. You will need to check your OIDC provider's documentation to understand which claims are available and how to request them.
2. **Create or Update XWiki User Properties**: Identify the user properties in XWiki where you want to map the additional user profile fields from the OIDC provider. If these properties do not exist, you will need to create them using XWiki's administration interface or by editing the `xwiki.cfg` configuration file.
3. **Modify the OIDC Authenticator**: You may need to modify the OpenID Connect Authenticator Extension to handle the additional user profile fields. This could involve changing the code to request and process the necessary claims from the UserInfo endpoint, then storing them in the appropriate XWiki user properties.
4. **Test the Configuration**: After implementing the changes, test the OIDC authentication process to ensure that the new user profile fields are being correctly mapped to XWiki user properties.

Please note that this is a general guide and might not cover all specifics of your setup. If you need more detailed assistance, I recommend consulting the documentation for your specific OIDC provider and reaching out to the XWiki community or support services for additional guidance.

sources.content:
"rver

A [configuration example for Univention Corporate Server (UCS)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/OpenID%20Connect/OpenID%20Connect%20Authenticator/OpenID%20Authentication%20with%20UCS/) is available.

## Configuration files

### xwiki.cfg

#-# The authentication management class.  
xwiki.authentication.authclass=org.xwiki.contrib.oidc.auth.OIDCAuthServiceImpl### xwiki.properties

#-# The base URL of the OpenId Connect Provider to use as starting point to discover the provider configuration.  
#-# See following endpoints properties if the provider is does not support OpenID Connect discovery.  
#-# If not indicated and not custom endpoint is provided, it will be asked to the user.  
# oidc.provider=https://xwikiorg-node1.xwikisas.com/xwiki/oidc  
  
#-# The generic OpenId Connect endpoints to use to communicate with the provider.  
#-# It's generally not needed when providing the provider discovery endpoint (which is supposed to provide those enpoints).  "

"xwiki/bin/download/Extension/OpenID%20Connect/OpenID%20Connect%20Authenticator/WebHome/oidc_client_provider.png?rev=1.1)

Release notes can be found on [OpenID Connect project page](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/OpenID%20Connect/#HReleaseNotes).

# Main limitations

* [Automatically authenticate user when coming back](https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/OIDC-16)

# Configuration

## Configuration Guides for specific systems

### Lemon LDAP / Open PAAS

A [configuration guide](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/OpenID%20Connect/OpenID%20Connect%20Authenticator/ConfigurationLemonLDAP/) is available to connect XWiki to LemonLDAP / OpenPAAS using the OpenIDC XWiki client.

### OpenID Authentication with Keycloak

A [configuration example for Keycloak](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/OpenID%20Connect/OpenID%20Connect%20Authenticator/OpenID%20Authentication%20with%20Keycloak/) is available.

### Univention Corporate Server

A [config"

"Wiki.

  
Once you installed the extension you will need to indicate you want to use it as authenticator with the property xwiki.authentication.authclass in xwiki.cfg file. See [Configuration section](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/OpenID%20Connect/OpenID%20Connect%20Authenticator/#HConfiguration) for more details.

# Dependencies

Dependencies for this extension (org.xwiki.contrib.oidc:oidc-authenticator 2.8.6):

* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-oldcore 14.10
* com.nimbusds:oauth2-oidc-sdk 11.10.1
* [org.xwiki.contrib.oidc:oidc-provider](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/OpenID%20Connect/OpenID%20Connect%20Provider/) 2.8.6
* org.xwiki.contrib.oidc:oidc-authenticator-configuration 2.8.6
* org.xwiki.contrib.oidc:oidc-authenticator-user 2.8.6

" set in xwiki.cfg configuration file (if the property does not already exist, create it):

xwiki.authentication.createuser=empty## OpenId Connect Authentication

See the [OpenId Connect Authenticator Extension](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/OpenID%20Connect/OpenID%20Connect%20Authenticator/).

## Active Directory

If you're looking to connect XWiki to an Active Directory server, you currently have 2 options:

* Using the manual and generic approach using the [LDAP Authenticator extension](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/)
* Using the dedicated [Active Directory Application](https://store.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/ActiveDirectoryApplication) which is a paying application dedicated to simplifying the integration of Active Directory with XWiki. The Active Directory Application allows you to easily connect your Active Directory server to XWiki using a **visual editor**, update **advanced configuration** settings"
